VAGINAL HEMORRHAGE
Indications
• Profuse or abnormal vaginal bleeding, any bleeding in pregnancy, including signs of shock
ALS RMC
Non-pregnant Pregnant >20 3rd trimester or Post-partum
weeks post-partum and placenta
• Trendelenberg
with blood loss delivered
position • Position on left
>500ml
side and support • Fundal
abdomen, • 2nd large-bore IV massage and
including put infant to
patients breast, if
immobilized on appropriate
backboard
• NS 250ml IV/IO
• MR as needed to maintain SBP ≥ 100
